articles.author: James Oliphant, Steve Holland
articles.description: President Joe Biden on Wednesday addressed the nation for the first time since dropping his reelection bid, saying he decided to forgo personal ambition to save democracy in a sedate Oval Office speech that contrasted with the rough-and-tumble campaign.
articles.title: With Biden out, Trump and Harris exchange barbs in reset US presidential race

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle, Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told the U.S. Congress on Wednesday he was confident that efforts to secure the release of hostages held in Gaza would succeed while pro-Palestinian demonstrators took to nearby streets.
articles.title: Netanyahu speech draws thousands of protesters to the US Capitol

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Police used pepper spray on some of the thousands of pro-Palestinian protesters who gathered outside the U.S. Capitol on Wednesday while Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke to Congress.
articles.title: Netanyahu speech draws thousands of protesters to the US Capitol

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Typhoon Gaemi blew through northern Taiwan on Thursday, killing two people, bringing floods and leading to traffic snarls, before heading across the sea and into China where it is expected to bring further torrential rain.
articles.title: Typhoon Gaemi barrels through Taiwan, killing two, heads to Chinese coast

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: North Korea has sent about 500 balloons laden with trash into South Korea's air space over the past 24 hours, officials in the South said on Thursday, disrupting flights and igniting a fire on the roof of a residential building.
articles.title: North Korea trash balloons disrupt flights in Seoul, cause rooftop fire

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: The United States and Vietnam are discussing the sale of Lockheed Martin C-130 Hercules military transport planes to Hanoi, two people familiar with the discussions said, in a sign of closer security cooperation between the two former foes.
articles.title: Exclusive: US, Vietnam discuss supplying Hanoi with C-130 military transport planes, sources say

articles.author: Steve Holland, Jasper Ward
articles.description: Negotiations on a ceasefire-for-hostages deal in the Gaza conflict appear to be in their closing stages and U.S. President Joe Biden and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will discuss remaining gaps on Thursday, a senior U.S. official said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire negotiations appear to be in closing stages, senior US official says

articles.author: David Stanway
articles.description: Rich countries have left a "leadership void" in climate politics and must provide trillions of dollars to help developing nations cut their greenhouse gas emissions, the BASIC bloc of Brazil, South Africa, India and China said late on Wednesday.
articles.title: BASIC bloc slams 'leadership void' on climate change, finance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A marine tanker carrying industrial fuel sank in rough seas off the Philippines on Thursday, causing a large oil spill as coast guard rescuers search for a missing crew member, officials said.
articles.title: Tanker capsizes off Philippines, one crew missing, battle to contain oil spill

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 18 people were killed when a small plane crashed and caught fire while it was taking off from Nepal's capital Kathmandu on Wednesday, officials said.
articles.title: At least 18 dead in Nepal plane crash, officials say
